meanings.definition: To slide unintentionally for a short distance.
meanings.sent1: I almost slip on the wet floor.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to slip on the ice outside.
meanings.sent3: While dancing, I slip and slide across the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her words made me slip into a state of confusion.
meanings.sent5: The banana peel made the floor a slip hazard.

meanings.sent1: Making a slip in the calculation can lead to big problems.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the slip in the report and corrected it.
meanings.sent3: His slip in judgment cost him the game.
meanings.sent4: The slip in the plan caused delays in the project.
meanings.sent5: Even a small slip in concentration can affect your performance.

meanings.definition: A piece of paper or cardboard used to label or identify something.
meanings.sent1: Attach the slip to the package for identification.
meanings.sent2: The slip on the box indicates its contents.
meanings.sent3: I found a slip with the product details on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The slip on the book helped me find it in the library.
meanings.sent5: The slip on the doorbell showed the delivery was missed.

meanings.definition: A woman's undergarment that is worn under a skirt or dress.
meanings.sent1: She bought a new slip to wear under her dress.
meanings.sent2: The slip she wore was comfortable and smooth.
meanings.sent3: Her slip matched the color of her dress perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The slip peeked out from under her skirt as she walked.
meanings.sent5: The slip added a layer of elegance to her outfit.
